alert.note: Alert for Klamath Basin (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freeze Watch issued June 11 at 5:34PM PDT until June 13 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...A very cold air mass will create the chance of sub- freezing temperatures as low as 26 degrees possible. * WHERE...Portions of Klamath County including Chiloquin, Modoc Point, Lorella, Midland and outlying areas of Klamath Falls. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freezing conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Frost may also be possible for areas outside of the freeze watch depending on cloud cover. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
